data.name: Footie Formations
data.description:
## The background âš½
Association Football / soccer rules state that the game must be played with a maximum of 11 players (not including substitutes). That is: one goalkeeper and a maximum of ten outfield players.

The rules do not specify any player positions apart from the goalkeeper, but the specialised roles for outfield players are typically
- defenders
- midfielders
- forwards

Formations can be expressed as the number of defenders, then the number of midfielders, then the number of forwards. For example 3-5-2 would be 3 defenders, 5 midfielders and 2 forwards.

## The function
For this Kata, complete the function so that given the inputs of
- a `position` and 
- a `count` of players in that given position

it outputs all possible formations as '{number of defenders}-{number of midfielders}-{number of forwards}', with formations separated by a new line character.

## The assumptions
- The position name can only be one of 'Defender', 'Midfielder', 'Forward'
- The count of players in that given position will be provided as an integer between 0 and 10
- All formations will use the maximum 10 outfield players, i.e. the counts for the three positions should always have a sum of 10

## The example
With the input of `position` 'Defender' and `count` 4, one possible expected output would be
`'4-0-6\n4-1-5\n4-2-4\n4-3-3\n4-4-2\n4-5-1\n4-6-0'`

Explanation: The defender count is provided so we know all formations will be expressed as '4-{number of midfielders}-{number of forwards}' with the sum of the midfielder count and the forward count being 6 (the 10 total outfield players less the 4 defenders already assigned).

## The last note
The order of the formations in the output is not important e.g. for `position` Defender and `count` 9, both '9-0-1\n9-1-0' and '9-1-0\n9-0-1' would be acceptable outputs
